The lapse of the stream by my cot,</br>Incessant that babbled along;</br>Its murmurs are wholly forgot,</br>Nor heard in reply to my song:</br>No longer my garden it laves,</br>In silence its current is chain'd;</br>The limpid display of its waves,</br>In chrystaliz'd bondage detain'd.

The hillock, from whence I survey'd</br>The sheep straying wide o'er the mead;</br>The lambkins in gambols that play'd;</br>The steers as they straggled to feed;</br>The hillock is crested with snow,</br>More white than the fleece of my fold;</br>The ploughmen as wareless they go,</br>Behold how they shiver with cold!

Go boy fill the crib in the dale,</br>The snow from the turnip remove;</br>'Tis ev'ning, and home to the pail,</br>The strawberry cow must be drove.</br>The door of the birchin-roof'd shed</br>Forget not to carefully guard,</br>Lest prowling sly Reynard should tread</br>The path of the straw-cover'd yard.

'Tis evening, the tortoiseshell cat</br>Her back turns oblique to the grate;</br>Old Thisbe forms presage at that,</br>Declares cheerless omens await:</br>The kitten in freaks ever gay,</br>Climbs over the mastiff asleep,</br>Unmindful of which, honest Tray</br>Rejects not his slumbers to keep.

Shall winter's dark sadness annoy,</br>Spread horror and gloom o'er the breast;</br>The heart rob of comfort and joy,</br>The Muse in her flight be unbless'd,</br>Prevent it Melpomene maid</br>To whose sacred impulse belong</br>Luxurious sorrows array'd</br>In measure of plaint-pouring song.

Then come tragic fair and essay,</br>Dejected to kindle my strain,</br>And shed a pale glance on my lay,</br>Of ev'ning be seen in the train;</br>Of storms and of tempests I sing;</br>Of hurricanes rude from the North,</br>Or aid in perspective to bring</br>Most shocking severities forth.

Ah no pensive maid let us hide</br>Such scenes of distress and surprize;</br>Submit my faint pencil to guide</br>As o'er rural landscape it flies:</br>Blow winds, and ye rains rapid pour</br>In deluge all over the plain;</br>Ye surges contend with the shore,</br>Bid Neptune most dreadfully reign.

When frosts the clear rivers impede,</br>And snow covers nature with white;</br>The duck by the sportsman shall bleed,</br>If murder can measure delight:</br>Let death vegetation destroy,</br>The warblers of aether be dumb;</br>Bright Phoebus emit not a joy,</br>Clouds, vapours, and night-terrors come.

To the cottage low-roof'd I repair,</br>Tranquillity's pleasures to greet;</br>Unharrass'd by scorpion tongu'd care,</br>They circle my Celadon's seat,</br>The ev'ning of winter to cheer;</br>He steals from the frowns of the hour,</br>Do friends uninvited appear,</br>The season no longer shall lour.

His hut of rusticity sounds</br>With all that is guileless and gay,</br>His table with liquor abounds,</br>Hilarity kindles up May.</br>Sociality brightens each smile,</br>In converse both harmless and pure,</br>Forgot is the season of toil,</br>And peace guards from tumult the door.

T' amuse or improve is the task,</br>The goblet flies social around,</br>The ev'ning's forgot the flask,</br>By ballad traditional crown'd;</br>Content smooths the brow of each guest,</br>For she to the cottage can bring</br>Those enviable poppies of rest,</br>From peace that continually spring.</br>
